definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: They firmly took hold of all the lifelines of their national economy.
sentences.chinese: 他们把国民经济的命脉都牢牢抓到自己手中。

sentences.english: In short, it is the lifeblood of every Summoner in the League of Legends.
sentences.chinese: 总之，这是命脉中的每一个召唤联盟的传奇。

sentences.english: The municipal water supply network system is the city's life vein.
sentences.chinese: 城市给水管网系统，是城市的命脉。

sentences.english: He reportedly divvied up key spheres of interest, such as oil, among his 6 sons.
sentences.chinese: 据称，他的6个儿子瓜分了石油等国家命脉产业。

sentences.english: But it likely will be the lifeblood of your career.
sentences.chinese: 但不管若何，它可能将是你整个事业的命脉。

sentences.english: The people's government controlled the nation's economy and set up a state-owned socialist economy.
sentences.chinese: 人民政府控制经济命脉并建立了公有制社会主义经济。

sentences.english: You see, the flow of credit is the lifeblood of our economy.
sentences.chinese: 要知道，信贷流动可是我们经济命脉啊。

sentences.english: Politicians are the lifeblood of the Exchange as a country.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们把交易所视为国之命脉。

sentences.english: Money-raising is the key for the survival and the development of the university.
sentences.chinese: 高校筹资是高等学校生存和发展的命脉。

sentences.english: All vitals appear to be stabilized.
sentences.chinese: 所有命脉似乎稳定下来。

sentences.english: Trade is the lifeblood of our country.
Creativity is the lifeblood of a service economy.
sentences.chinese: 创意是服务型经济的命脉。

sentences.english: Data is the lifeblood of telecommunications companies.
sentences.chinese: 数据是电信公司的命脉。

sentences.english: Energy is the lifeblood of economic development.
sentences.chinese: 动力非儿官经济收铺的命脉。

sentences.english: THE economy of Kuwait is exceedingly well oiled.
sentences.chinese: 科威特的经济命脉极其依赖石油。

sentences.english: Water is the source of the life, and the lifeblood of human survival and development.
sentences.chinese: 水是生命之源，是人类生存与发展的命脉。

definition: to share the same interests (idiom)/to be closely related/to be in the same boat
to live or die/to exist or perish
lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect
pinyin: qian1 yi1 fa4 er2 dong4 quan2 shen1

definition: of the utmost importance/of highest priority
